reviews.text: Oh my gosh, this place was packed tonight!! We arrived just before 5:30 and we waited about an hour to be seated. My husband and I had a $25 gift card to spend, so we spent a good bit of our wait going over the lengthy menu and deciding what to order without going too much over that.<br><br>In the end, we decided to get a couple of appetizers and split a piece of cheesecake. We ordered the Dynamite Shrimp, which is tempura breaded shrimp with a side of what the menu describes as &#34;our spicy Dynamite sauce.&#34; The shrimp was absolutely delicious. The sauce was also very good, but I would not have described it as spicy.<br><br>The other appetizer we ordered was the Factory Nachos, which comes with cheese, guacamole, pico de gallo, sour cream, jalapeños, and green onion. The chips were on the thick side and very crispy, so they held up well to the cheese and other items on the nachos. This was a delicious plate of nachos, and it included a big &#39;ol dollop of sour cream, but sadly they really skimped on the guacamole, pico de gallo, and other items. At almost $13 for a dish with no meat, I really didn&#39;t feel like we got what we paid for. It was especially disappointing because the guac and pico were so doggone good.<br><br>Lastly, the strawberry cheesecake. The strawberries on ours were plump and perfectly ripe and included a nice sauce. As for the cheesecake itself, I have always felt that the cheesecake here is fine, but quite a bit dryer than some I&#39;ve had at other places that was better. As you would expect from their name, they do have a wide variety of different cheesecakes.<br><br>Overall, good food and friendly service, but I will say I agree with some of the other reviewers who have said it&#39;s overpriced. I certainly appreciate receiving the gift card someone gave us, but I don&#39;t know that I would come here without one and pay full price.

Went with my family for my birthday, the hosted asked us to wait outside of the restaurant because we didn&#39;t have masks. After an hour of waiting they denied us to come back in because we didn&#39;t have a mask to walk from the entrance to the table. She never said we needed masks just to walk to our table.

Food was outstanding as always. <br><br>Went inside to pick up an online order. Stood there for over ten minutes - was never greeted or acknowledged (I literally stood by the host stand while several employees continuously walked by me/ignored me over and over again. I finally forced myself to get someone&#39;s attention, who showed me to the area by the bakery with lots of pickup orders and said &#34;yup, they&#39;re arranged alphabetically so yeah..&#34; and left it at that. So, half confused, I began to sift through the orders to find my name. Immediately I was approached by another staff member who, in an almost perturbed tone, asked me &#34;can I help you sir...?&#34;. I was then directed to the appropriate pick up spot which was the cash register at the bakery. <br><br>This whole experience was a little more than frustrating. I was ignored by multiple staff for over ten minutes; then misdirected to the wrong area/method of pickup. <br><br>I understand COVID is a major issue/source of stress, and I am appreciative of restaurant employees that continue to work to provide us with good food, but I do not think a customer should be ignored for over ten minutes until they have to speak up to get their order. I have been coming to this location for a couple years now and will be rethinking things.

I visited Columbus from Michigan.  My first Encounter with the person that seated me wasn&#39;t pleasant.  But then God sent Josh P. my  waiter who smoothed things over. He noticed from a far the conversation and immediately turned things around and made me feel like a Queen amongst others.  He was patience. Make some fantastic recommendations. The food was delicious.  The manager was also Accommdating as well.  The next time I&#39;m here visiting. I will definitely reserve a seat at Josh P&#39;s table.

I ordered chicken fettuccine and it was bland bland bland. The best part of my meal was the bread. Season your pastas. It&#39;s like you just poured 3% milk on your pasta. I used to order this all the time and now I know why I stopped. I&#39;m politely asking you to get your crap together. I just wasted money trusting you. The only thing good about cheesecake factory is the cheesecake. I&#39;m Beginning to believe it&#39;s better to order food elsewhere and get dessert at cheesecake factory.

Ate here on an early Saturday evening with a group of 8. The wait for our table was about 75 minutes, understandable. They are famous for their huge menu and large portions. Once we were seated, everything clicked. I had a bowl of loaded potato soup and shared Thai lettuce wraps with  wife. That plus the bread and I was full. (Their dark wheat bread is awesome.) Got the lemoncello cake for dessert (to go).<br>Service was friendly, efficient and attentive. We had no complaints about anything. Several first timers in our group that were impressed. (Don&#39;t complain about the wait at peak times--this is a sign of a popular restaurant)
Food was good but the place was disgusting. There were crumbs all over the floor and it looked like it hasn&#39;t been vacuumed in a month. Bathrooms were disgusting as well. Go to another location.

I swore if never eat at cheesecake factory ever again. Because of the number of people we had and variety of tastes in food, we decided on CF. Big mistake! The food just is not good at all and for what you get, it&#39;s easy overpriced.
Took my wife to the cheesecake factory the food and service was the best I every had. Well go back very soon

Came here for my birthday dinner about a month and a half ago, but didn&#39;t have time to write a review until now.<br><br>The thing about Cheesecake Factory is that there&#39;s always a long line. According to my friend, the Polaris location has a shorter wait time compared to the one in Easton. <br><br>Food was good, albeit expensive. I&#39;ve always loved their chicken carbonara and so I opted to order my usual. Food had good flavor and enough creaminess. Portions were big enough to have leftovers. <br><br>Our server was the absolute best! She was hilarious and attentive. She brought our hungry group more bread and butter and even sang me happy birthday!  Kudos to her for her excellent service.

Came in for a late dinner on Saturday night,  I love how late they are open.  We were seated really quickly and the service was great!! Our witness was super attentive, our drinks were refilled without having to ask, the bread was warm and fresh.  I ordered a chicken dish and it was great. My husband ordered the spicy chicken sandwich which was huge! He also ordered the loaded potato soup and it tasted great.<br>Very good experience unfortunately we were too full for dessert!!
Great server!! Had an awesome conversation with the lady at the front desk. If i lived in Tennessee I&#39;d frequent tbat location more often :)

REFUSED BAR SERVICE AND TABLE CLEARED WHILE IN BATHROOM WITHOUT MY CONSENT!! I have been a customer of Cheesecake Factory be for years. This was the worst location I&#39;ve visited in North America! When I arrived I was read my rights about wearing a mask. The manager seated me near a very busy, loud, noisy location which I thought was odd. Of course Cheesecake Factory is loud but this particular area is where servers and bar hops work out of. The bread was cold when it arrived. I was not given straws for the drinks I ordered. Of course I sent asked for straws and I sent the bread back to the kitchen. There was a very hostile and over intrusive Caucasian female manager who constantly cane to my table and harassed me about mundane things. I believe she might have thought she was being helpful but she was not. It was harassment. I then proceeded to the bar while waiting for my food to arrive (which is my custom). The same manager came to the bar and again lectured me about rules, wearing a mask (I was wearing one the entire time) and she told me I could not order at the bar. I then proceeded to the restroom and she told me GOOD NIGHT! My food had not arrived so again, I struggled her rude and unwelcoming behavior off. When I returned my table had been cleared off and the manager stated she thought I was leaving. First, I had not paid my bill yet and I was waiting for a drink at the bar. I ordered the Fillet Mignon Entree and the steak was dry, unseasoned and the vegetables and mashed potatoes were not like any of the other locations. The food was awful and I was entirely disappointed. I confronted the female manager about her unwelcoming, rude and obnoxious behavior and she gave me one excuse after another but insisted that I was not a problem and she had no issues with me. Finally, a make manager came to my attention and asked if everything was okay. I td him about my experience and then I requested my bill. The manager had removed some items from my bill. I did not request this and I requested he put them back on the bill. Instead of him doing this he just printed out a duplicate copy of the original bill with all of my charges so as to mislead me to believe he charged me. I checked my bank account orior to leaving and behold it was the discounted charge that I objected to originally. I confronted him and he was embarrassed that I caught him. The entire experience was TERRIBLE, AWFUL and UNWELCOMING! I will return to this location but I will not be treated this way again. I like Cheesecake Factory but management will not treat customers, especially Black customers this way ever again! Trust and believe that. Derrick D. Blassingame, for the People!

Our server, Jordan H, was excellent! He was very friendly, professional, and very considerate. We&#39;ve been to this restaurant so many times but he left us very deep impression. His service made our dinner very enjoyable. The food were great and the sizes were still large. The only reason I didn&#39;t leave 5 star was the slippery floor!!!!! Be extremely cautious at the corner of each aisle because my friend almost fell there. And we heard the plates fell on the floor twice during our 1.5-hour stay. For the customers and the employees safety, the management may want to solve the slippery floor problem.

One of the worst Cheesecake Factories I&#39;ve been to. It was a very slow weekday night and the service was still awful. 3/3 times I&#39;ve been here, the service has always been poor. We always have to ask for refills and ask for items from another server. <br>Our server was no where to be found. Our food was good, just like any other Cheesecake, but the accommodations we asked for was not met. I assume the server just forgot to ring in &#34;sauce on the side&#34; or &#34;no peas&#34;. For the price we pay, we expect so much more. Giving 2 stars for how great their cheesecake is, the bakery always does a great job at plating them. I have had plenty of friends work at different Cheesecake Factories and I know their training is intense and very thorough. I don&#39;t know what happened with this location. It just wasn&#39;t great and after reading the replies from the managers, they don&#39;t really do anything about it. It&#39;s usually just &#34;Sorry, hope you come back. Don&#39;t forget to come during our discount days or Happy Hours&#34;. Like no, do something about the problem, saying sorry doesn&#39;t bring customers back.

I&#39;m generally not crazy about chain places, but I&#39;ve been to this location several times because if I give my kid the opportunity to pick where to eat, 9/10 we&#39;re eating at the Cheesecake Factory. Usually everything is fine. Overpriced, nothing super amazing but it&#39;s perfectly fine. <br><br>Our last visit was pretty nightmarish though. Slow, slow service. Less than enthusiastic server. My daughter had to ask for bread twice, we had to ask for refills. The appetizer came out way overcooked (Tex Mex eggrolls). The kids pizzas came out overcooked too. <br><br>I ordered the four cheese pasta, light sauce. I was given fettuccine alfredo. It took several minutes to get my servers attention as she dropped the plates and left before I could say anything. I told her I had ordered the four cheese pasta, and she said I had four cheese pasta. I asked about the marinara and ricotta it usually comes with and mentioned that it was usually penne. She said they must have mixed it up and said she&#39;d fix it. She left, and just came back with a bowl of ricotta. <br><br>Okay, fine, I like fettuccine alfredo. The kids start acting up toward the end of the meal so I hurry up and pay and leave. When I get home, I realize I&#39;ve been charged for four cheese pasta with chicken. <br><br>I&#39;ve emailed them twice about this and no one has ever responded so I guess I&#39;m going to air my grievances on yelp.

I had no idea this was here.  Since it was Sweetie&#39;s birthday, she picked where we would eat (who are we kidding, she always picks.)  She knew it was here, and we were nearby, so of course we went.  It&#39;s one of her favorites.  I would pick other places first, but I never object to TCF because I can always find something to eat and it&#39;s always at least good. <br><br>Huge menu, some pretty interesting items.  Kind of expensive.  Okay, very expensive for the portion size.  But, hey, sometimes you have to splurge.  Service was great, the booth was comfy, and Baby K had a menu to choose from.  She got mac and cheese, and a side of strawberries, and loved them.  I tried some mac and it was pretty darn good.  Sweetie got a Cobb salad and the stuffed mushrooms, and liked both.  I had the crab artichoke app, with a Dynamite Shrimp small plate.<br><br>The dip was excellent.  Lots of crab, lots of cheese, lots of artichoke.  Served with crispy bread slices.  The shrimp were... okay.  Not bad, but not at all spicy, and a very small portion.  But, hey, small plates.<br><br>We got cheesecake to go, because birthday, and Baby K wanted &#34;pink cake.&#34;  That turned out to be cherry cheesecake.  Haven&#39;t tasted that yet, but hopefully she lets me have some.  They are of course specialists, and the cheesecake is always good, and huge portions.<br><br>So.  A fun birthday dinner.  Not a place to go often, at those prices.  Something for everyone.  Good service.  We&#39;ll be back, I&#39;m sure.

One of my favorite places to eat with friends or family. Their menu is extensive and there is something to find for everyone. Plus, when you are craving cheesecake there is not many other options that compare. <br><br>A favorite to many, there is usually some sort of wait time. Don&#39;t go expecting to be seated right away and if you do consider it a bonus. The staff is friendly. Cheesecake staff seem to thrive in the busy environment. Every time I have gone the waitstaff has been attentive and always has a smile for their patrons. <br><br>I love going here to catch up with those I don&#39;t see often. It is a nice meeting place.
Great food and service was out of this world! The fresh strawberry shortcake for desert is the perfect way to top of your meal.
Sat at the bar with Joseph and had a great experience! Very attentive, good conversation without being overbearing. The pork chop was excellent as well! Will be back!

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory...pretty standard. But what I found disappointing was that I paid $17.00 for a &#34;Chicken Avocado Salad&#34; that probably had 3 ounces of chicken on it and MAYBE 1/4 of an avocado. The rest of the bowl was all greens and carrots. Now I DID tell them to hold the tortilla strips (I&#39;m low carb), but this salad was so sparse on chicken and avocado that it was ridiculous. It probably cost them less than $3.00 to make it-WAY overpriced. But again, it&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory. I should have known better. I will NOT go back if I want a salad. And since I don&#39;t eat desserts, there isn&#39;t really ay draw for me to go back ever.<br><br>The salad tasted fine. It was just too sparse.

Unfortunately I got serious food poisoning from this location this week. I ordered the &#34;skinnylicious chopped salad&#34; but substituted ranch dressing. It tasted fine, but within 6 hours of my meal, I was vomiting, etc. I felt like I was dying. I do not recommend :(

Wait time - 20+ minutes<br>Service - 3 stars. Took a while just to get the water.<br>Blue moon out of stock. Bread was too hard to bite.<br>Appetizers- Korean Cauliflower was too raw to eat that they hv to take it back.<br>Egg rolls were kind of soggy, no flavor.<br>Margarita Pizza- worst pizza ever had. Even papa john makes better pizza than this. Crest was raw. U can actually see the rawness. Pizza sauce was falling all over. Totally spoiler for my wife&#39;s birthday dinner. Never going to come here again.<br>I had better experiences in other cities but this was a disaster.

Everything was just great!! The food was fabulous as always! Our server was very attentive but not annoying either. Perfect! Very similar decor as other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s close to my house. Their menu is always insane!! I love having different choices but really! I had the Salted Caramel Cheesecake- it was absolutely divine!!

Stopped by after work and placed a carry out order. It was 5:30, I waited 25 minutes for just an order of the chicken taquitos &amp; 2 slices of cheesecake. Once I got home &amp; opened the bag, I realized I should have checked my order before leaving. The taquitos appetizer was so unappealing, it looked half eaten!! It was so sloppy (and trust me I am one to avoid tipping the bag)! Why would 4 little portions be placed in such a large container. Threw it out!

I ordered from this location after a couple of months and I am very unsatisfied with the service they provided. The Caesar&#39;s salad was missing the croutons. There was no bread with the order and when I inquired about the bread, they said they no longer give bread with the orders. I&#39;m very disappointed.

Amy was our server. Did okay, nothing special. We ordered the Renee&#39;s Special. I had the chicken salad, Lynnette had the turkey. Both of us had the salad and baked potato soup. Everything was great. Love the starter bread the best. Also ordered desert for later. Who doesn&#39;t get desert when coming here. Yummy!!

I am a huge fan of the Cheesecake Factory but I know it&#39;s never going to be much more than a fancy chain restaurant.<br><br>The portions are huge (and very expensive), so I recommend either eating an app and cheesecake or an entree and getting the cheesecake to go.<br><br>This experience was ok. We didn&#39;t wait for more than 30 minutes, our waitress, Marcella was very friendly and very attentive to the details of our orders. When the food arrived, they tried to place it at the table next to us (the couple was very confused). The same thing happened to us after we paid and the table next to us received their food (guess the runners aren&#39;t very attentive to table number?)<br><br>There are so many cheesecake options, I&#39;ll always be back for more.

LOVE THE FOOD HERE. Always outstanding dishes with good service. Our food was slow coming out (watched my fiancée eat a delicious Belgian Waffle in front of my face whilst waiting for my meal). But it&#39;s the holidays and IT&#39;S BUSY!! Definitely coming back

For years The Cheesecake Factory has been a favorite of ours whether just a night out or on vacation. We always knew we would get good food, whatever we chose on the menu. I&#39;m sad to see they seem to be on a downhill slide. Inconsistent in many ways. Last night, had it been my first visit would have certainly made me think never again. <br><br>I ordered an old favorite the Factory Burrito. It came out after obviously sitting way to long. It was semi warm at best. The side of black beans had so much smoke flavoring they were inedible. The guacamole was brown, past it&#39;s prime. I ate half the burrito and had the server box the rest. As I sit here now eating the reheated half, I cut through it to discover it is literally nothing but white rice, a few corn kernels and a tablespoon of chicken. <br><br>They seem to be going the way of so many chains- cutting corners to make profit. I guess the killing they&#39;re making on the cheesecake  just isn&#39;t enough. Won&#39;t be going back, and it&#39;s not just this location.

Can&#39;t ever go wrong with this place because the menu is so massive. Be prepared for a wait time on weekend nights. Favorite appetizers are: avocado egg rolls, egg roll sampler (best way to try four different types), and favorite dishes are: Louisiana chicken pasta (love the flavor), chicken madeira, and Jamaican black peppered shrimp (I usually get the combo with shrimp and chicken). The cheesecake selection is massive, so far my favorites have been: chocolate mousse, tiramisu, and salted caramel.

Went here today for lunch. Food and service were both great. Our waiter, Cayson, was on top of everything, checking in on us frequently, refilling drinks and very friendly. My only criticisms would be that the tops of the green beans still had the stems on them and the waiting area was very crowded. With people coming and going, waitresses going back and forth trying to get cheesecake for guests and people trying to get to the restroom it was a mess. They have that long hallway of an entry, which I feel would cut down on some crowdedness by adding some benches for people to sit while waiting.

Meh. My entree was under seasoned and there were several pieces of fat in the chicken. I seriously had to spit food discretely into my napkin while at lunch with several coworkers. Gross. The chicken lettuce wraps were amazing as an appetizer, which is why I am giving 3 starts instead of 2. No complaints about my sever at all. Friendly and kept the water coming. $20 for a pile of rice and some chicken should mean that I don&#39;t have to spit any of it out.

This was my first time going to the cheesecake factory and I wasn&#39;t very impressed. The portion sizes are ridiculous. That&#39;s why it&#39;s so expensive. I don&#39;t get it. I mean who eats that much in one sitting? I got spaghetti and meatballs. The sauce was super watery and flavorless on the pasta. Idk if they put a different sauce on the meatballs or what because that sauce was thick and pretty good there. Maybe I got two different batches? Not sure. The spaghetti was cold  except for underneath the meatballs so I have a feeling my food was sitting for awhile before it was served. It took an hour to get our food so don&#39;t go if you want a quick dinner. My BF got a stuffed cheese burger which was really good but the fries didn&#39;t have any seasoning at all... not even salt. I will say that the strawberry cheesecake was super good. I&#39;ll go back for that cheesecake alone.

I know they say eat local. I did for my daughter&#39;s 12th birthday and had terrible experience at the original pancake house in upper arlington close to where I live. So i decided to make it up to her a day later (still her birthday weekend) so I drove all the way to Polaris Cheesecake Factory because I knew from years ago they do a little birthday song and they have amazing cheesecake. <br><br>Our server Jordan H was very attentive and provided awesome service. Him and a group of theirs sang for my daughter and we were all cheerful and happy. Food was great and everything just made up for the humiliating dining experienced we had a day earlier. <br><br>I know people say chain restaurants can be boring but this one isn&#39;t. Also I know that CF as a publicly traded corporation would make sure they have the best hired staff and management to rectify situations should a problem during your dining visit occur. <br><br>Will definitely be back again!

Birthday date night with my wife. We arrived Friday night about 6:50p and were seated at 7:35. This place was packed and super busy, but the service was top notch, and the staff were very attentive. It&#39;s somewhat dark which makes it a bit hard to see the menu, and the menu is 19 pages long! That&#39;s a bit overwhelming, however there are only about 4 pages that are specific for food and the rest is appetizers, desserts, and other things. Once we figured out the 2 pages that interested us we decided quickly on what to eat. I chose the Chicken Madeira which according to the menu was sauteed chicken breast topped with asparagus and melted mozzarella cheese, covered with fresh mushroom madeira sauce and a side of mashed potatoes.<br> <br>This meal was very tasty and the portion size was rather large. I was able to take home half of my meal and have it for lunch the next day.<br> <br>We shared the Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple (Cheesecake with Caramel, peanut butter, Butterfinger and Reese&#39;s peanut butter cups).  What a wonderful piece of heaven this cheesecake was.<br> <br>The food is very good and the portion sizes are very large, however the price for the meals and the cheesecake are also high.  I would like to see a place like this reduce the size of their meals, which would allow the price to come down as well.<br> <br>We had a wonderful visit and enjoyed our date night.

My favorite book? The Cheesecake Factory menu.  <br><br>When you&#39;re with your friends and your conversation transitions into the inevitable &#34;where do you want to go?&#34;, &#34;I don&#39;t know, where do you want to go?&#34;-- this is the place you go.  <br><br>There isn&#39;t anything I find particularly special about their food (with the exception of their cheesecakes), other than the fact that there is literally something for everyone, and you&#39;ll never hate what you order.  It&#39;s incredibly consistent and you&#39;ll never leave hungry.  Like, ever.  The only thing you&#39;ll hate is deciding what to order because there are SO many options.  <br><br>Also, portions.. WHO EATS THIS MUCH FOOD??  Each entree is large enough to feed a small village and then some.  Now, their cheesecake is above par, although I don&#39;t recall actually ever eating cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory, because there is simply no room left after dinner.  But I&#39;m resourceful, so I always order it to goooo! And enjoy it as a midnight snack.<br><br>Do make sure you eat the bread.  Always so warm and SO delicious.  <br><br>Favorite apps: <br>1. avocado rolls- if you haven&#39;t tried them yet, you&#39;re missing out. <br>2. Calamari- perfectly crispy and so very tasty.<br>3. Warm crab and Artichoke dip- I could eat this all day, every day.  <br><br>As for the entrees, I mean, I&#39;ve never gotten anything I haven&#39;t liked, and as far as I&#39;m concerned  neither will you!  My go-to is definitely the chicken Alfredo or the Thai salmon, both good.  <br><br>If you&#39;re going on a Friday or Saturday night, make sure you call ahead and make a reservation. It tends to get quite crowded.  Give their Nutella cheesecake a try. It&#39;s pretty spectacular!!

All around average. Usually go to Easton. Main dishes were great, got pineapple chicken and my man got the steak...appetizer nacho was not that good wouldn&#39;t recommend also Mac n cheese is sub par. A little under whelmed on this visit not gonna lie.

It&#39;s great and the same and expensive and exactly what you remember every time you go .  The menu is massive the Cheesecake is delicious but $7-$8 a slice is ridiculous in my opinion.  The pasta and shrimp are good and the portions are big.  Never feel cheated and the service is always great .  Once a year is enough for me but if you&#39;ve never been it&#39;s worth it.

I don&#39;t know what happened but the food used to be better and the portions bigger. Used to like this restaurant by last couple times I was disappointed. Service was terrible. Ordered two appetizers and two entrees and waiter brings entrees and I ask about appetizers and they forgot to put in the order. Manager apologized but when I go out I just want people to do their job

Everytime we want to eat here it is too full. THERE IS ALWAYS A WAIT. Haven`t got a chance to sit down inside for a year. Couldn&#39;t even get in around my birthday. But maybe that means the food and service is good. I&#39;v only ate here twice when I got lucky when it wasn&#39;t crowded. However, when it&#39;s too full I just stick with the cheesecake since it takes me an hour to drive over here. I hardly ever get out but maybe I will get a chance this year to dine in. With the virus and everything going on I`m hoping that more people will quit filling up restaurants and stay at home saving money. I`m trying to say this nicely and I hope I get my chance this year but those of you that are so dependent on eating out please please at stay home!

First time coming to a Cheesecake Factory in about 10 years. Forgot how massive the menu is and how big the portions are. Same as any other Cheesecake Factory I&#39;m sure but just felt the need to point out the great service we received. The service was phenomenal on a busy day at the mall, the bartender Shontaye was covering our section and even though they were down a team member she busted her tail and did a great job.
Don&#39;t order from Door Dash because the Cheese Cake Factory will not address the issue. You have to be there. Even if you can take a pic of clearly a bone in your pork.

Way over priced for just okay/maybe a bit on the rich side cheese cake.  I think this chains head has swollen and it&#39;s quality has shrunk and the prices have grown with its head. Unless I&#39;m out voted when picking a place to eat, I won&#39;t spend my money here. Much better food and cheese cake at much more reasonably priced restaurants.

There are so many options it&#39;s difficult to know what to eat. Everything is flavorful and you always come home with a to go box.  The specialty cheesecakes are amazing though the simple cheesecake is just alright.  The service is good and quick.  Though it seems they don&#39;t really go out of their way to make your visit exceptional.

Okay it&#39;s a chain so my expectations aren&#39;t really high but it&#39;s usually consistently good. We were really hungry so we ordered two appetizers &amp; our entrees. The appetizers took a long time to get to us. Then of course the entrees came 2 minutes later which left us no room on our table to even set our drinks &amp; a choice of whether to eat our appetizers &amp; let our entrees get cold or skip the appetizers. We expressed our feelings about it to a manager &amp; he offered to comp an appetizer. That wasn&#39;t satisfactory since both were going to waste. He didn&#39;t seem to care. Our waitress with the Amy Winehouse tattoo was blasé about it, &#34;not my fault.&#34;  Ended up just sending one entree back. On top of it, my daughter&#39;s pasta Alfredo was flavorless. I would go back to Cheesecake Factory but not this location.

It&#39;s already been a hectic day, you would like to go to a nice restaurant but can&#39;t because your family took forever getting ready and everything of quality is closed, you go to cheesecake factory because they stay open a little later, right? WRONG! Horrible customer service/attitude at the hostess stand, horrible/lazy server, horrible wait time and HORRIBLE food. (NO steaks on the menu tonight because the stove/grill is exerting smoke throughout the restaurant and 2 apps they couldn&#39;t serve because they ran out.) Never again.

The food is very good, consistently.  However, over the past 6 months the time from order to table is sooooooo long. This is true even during off times.  Come on guys, pick up the pace.  Tired of hearing, &#34;sorry about the wait.&#34;
OMG!! We are so happy with the cake and cookies in The Cheesecake Factory.  The great taste and combinations are so awesome. <br><br>The cake chocolate fudge cake is so tasty I love it!!

Fantastic.<br><br>Absolutely reeks of quality, outstanding service, and value.  One of the better meals I have had in a while.  Coupled with outstanding service, this was a win.  I don&#39;t often leave a five-star review, but this one was earned.<br><br>The food was perfect, the atmosphere was great.  Resulting in, a wonderful evening.<br><br>You will not be disappointed to dine here.

This is a solid Cheesecake Factory.  I have been here quite a few times, and haven&#39;t had any real issues.  The only actual complaint that I ever have is the wait times.  <br>Other than that, I have had great meals and drinks here.  They get my order right every time.<br>They can be considered on the more expensive side of things, but usually things around Polaris are.  So, use this as a celebration or special night out meal only if needed.<br><br>Try the RED VELVET cheesecake!  Quite decedent.

Curbside pickup on busy day it wonderful to pull up and have food delivered. <br>Things I love to eat. Hibachi steak wonderful meal with mashed potato and asparagus. Fire roasted artichokes are seasonal great if you know how to eat artichokes. Cheesecake is always wonderful but try there chocolate cake yummy!

This review is for this location.<br><br>One can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. We came here for dinner this evening (Saturday). There were 7 of us, and we knew there would be something for everyone here. We ordered the buffalo chicken blasts, tex mex egg rolls and the guacamole egg rolls as appetizers. All were yummy as usual. For dinner I had the southern fried catfish dinner. The fish was nice and juicy, and not too doughy. Strawberry lemonade was fantastic! My family ordered dessert but I didn&#39;t try any as I was full from appetizers and dinner.<br><br>Service was excellent... Thank you Megan!<br><br>As we can here later in the evening (around 9:30 pm) there was ample parking. However, I am sure parking is scarcer during peak dinner or mall hours.

I haven&#39;t been to The Cheesecake Factory for a while. One things that I like is their menu is endless and have so much selection. Of course, I can&#39;t finish the meal without ordering their cheesecake.

Go for the cheesecake and eat dinner elsewhere. Food was mediocre. Our food arrived about 15 minutes apart so we were eating at different times. The milkshake was just milk with Oreos smashed (it was warm so the ice cream was completely melted).<br><br>Overall, for the price there are many other options to get better food in Columbus. The cheesecake isn&#39;t really worth the long wait.

This was the slowest CF I have ever been in. OMGOODNESS if I had been with my spouse on a date I would have been furious because this is all you was able to do. The wait for a table Saturday night wasn&#39;t bad however the wait for everything else was horrible. My fries was so salty they were disgusting. When I needed a water refill no ice was ever added and the last refill the water was pee warm. I would think it would be common sense to put ice in with an ice water. I specifically asked for a refill of ICE WATER. I had to wait forever to ask for some ice. I mean everything took forever. We got our cheesecake for to go and was told that&#39;s why our wait was so long for it. We spent hours and only one of us had a meal the other had a drink and dessert. So if you plan a dinner and a movie or something kiss that goodbye or plan for dinner to take hours. I&#39;m a slow eater and this was off the charts. I needed so much water cause the fries was so salty and I didn&#39;t want to waste more time by having that fixed. Asked for some mayo and it was forever getting it for my sandwich then it wasn&#39;t what my sandwich had but I used it. There was so much fat and gristle I had a sandwich worth of it piled up that was inedible. This was ridiculous for the price. Horrible not worth it!
Every time I come here I don&#39;t have to wait long to get seated, the service is always great and so is the food. :) :) My favorite dish here is orange chicken with rice. Love it!
Last night, I had the worst dinner ever. An hour and 20min till the food was served. Food was cold and tasteless. Don&#39;t waste your money

We go to Cheesecake Factory ALL OVER, but for some strange reason this one consistently drops the ball. Does this one have a different kind of staff than ANY OTHER one in the World????<br>All orders are slow in coming,, or  they mess it up,. Because it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory and we are usually fans we keep trying, but it&#39;s annoying!!<br>Wish someone from Corporate would come out and shake this .<br><br>WELL!!!........ The above was my former review, but I got a call from one of the managers Jordan&#39;s who I was able to talk to-about the problem and they have really made an effort to improve this cheesecake factory We are in Ohio right now visiting again and we have gone there twice and it has been much better. So I&#39;m raising my former  review to four stars because they deserve it<br><br>Thanks again Cheesecake Factory and Jordana for being on top of what&#39;s going on!!!!!

We stopped by for coffee and cheesecake, and received what amounts to hot water/food color for coffee.  Oh yeah, I don&#39;t need to be told 2-3 times that it takes 10 minutes to brew coffee.   Finally got the cheesecake which looks great. Will update once the &#34;10 minute&#34; coffee arrives.

I have never been to this location before, and took my girlfriend for her first visit. The food was great. I had a combo plate with steak and shrimp, she had some avocado rolls.  We ended with some nice pieces of cheesecake. Price was what we expected. The room was nice the restaurant was nice.  Our experience was just average.  There were visible open tables, but we had to wait when we arrived.  After a 30 minute wait we landed some seats at the bar. The bartender just recited caned lines, forgot to bring a drink, and was not responsive. We asked for some decaf coffee with our deserts and that was almost unacceptable to the bartender. We are very sure he just gave us regular after waiting forever for coffee.  Our bill was wrong and the bartender couldn&#39;t care less. And that was our experience, the people were meh at best, they have a packed house and were making money, not customers. The food is excellent but expensive. I&#39;ll return, but won&#39;t beat a path back.

Loud music, very dim lights, very hot and stuffy. If I wanted these things I would go to a club. This is my first and last visit to this place. <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2FNot.to&amp;s=440fb0ab2201f8431fea3c1dd464792947128660417fe7566a17160fc8a8a511" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Not.to</a> mentoon I have been waiting on my food for over 30 minutes.

I&#39;ve always enjoyed the Cheesecake Factory and I was again very pleased with my cheesecake...the cafe au lait one this time. Delicious! The food was just ok (and I expect very good food from this restaurant). I will say the manager impressed me, I had originally ordered the cauliflower appetizer, and she came out to let me know the cauliflower was not up to par. She then asked if I&#39;d like to try another appetizer. I appreciate the attention to detail and quality.
Great menu. Beautiful restaurant. Great service. Do not sit in the bar. They have CNN news on. Fake and lying news. I cannot believe a restaurant  bar would have this nonsense on. How demoralizing.

We originally had a group of 10 people and one of my friends didn&#39;t attempt to place a reservation so they said there was about an hour wait for us, which was perfectly fine by us. We were celebrating my friends birthday. We found out some of our friends weren&#39;t coming so we told them the update and they said it was helpful and seated us almost immediately. We had a bunch of balloons for the birthday girl and they had nothing against us bringing them in which was good. The waitress was really nice and the food was really good. I do believe the food was a little bit overpriced, at least the crab bites that we got. They were almost $9 for 5 small crab bites. They were delicious though. When they brought our desserts, they sang Happy Birthday with our friends and helped us celebrate. We also heard at least 3 other birthday celebrations going on there. A great place for celebrations, but it is expensive.

Amazing food... we had Nate as a waiter and the service was terrible. We were forgotten about and ruined the experience of the day with my family. Will I go back? Yes, but only because it&#39;s normally not the experience we have there

sat at the bar, placed an order for pulled pork sliders...after waiting THIRTY FIVE mins (my lunch is only an hour) they came after i bothered bartender/waitress again..the fries were cold and they were missing slaw! Was told that it &#39;takes time&#39; to get the pulled pork right...yeah right, how long does it really take for 3 freakin&#39; sliders?!

A restaurant of this caliber , known for their good food and variety , should NEVER have such inconsistency in their meals and carry out meals especially. After good experiences carrying out with these items a week ago , last night = Almost raw avocado egg rolls. Poorly done Korean cauliflower. <br>We eat there very often and may decrease that significantly now. Be careful. It can be great. Or terrible.

Our waitress completely ignored us &amp; when she would stop at our table her face would turn from a smile to a frown after she has been nice to the surrounding tables &amp; she would look away while we were speaking to her. We are always respectful at any place &amp; this treatment is absolutely unacceptable &amp; won&#39;t be tolerated; therefore, we&#39;ll never step into a cheesecake unless corrective action is taken by this company.

There were flies all over the restaurant ... about 20 that I could see from my seat. They kept trying to land in our food. If it&#39;s this bad in the dining room, I wonder what the kitchen must look like....

Come here if you want cheesecake. If you want anything that demands more service than that, this is not the place. Especially if you&#39;re hungry. My friend and I started out with an order of the lettuce wraps. We saw a small short white &#34;hair&#34; in the dead center of the dish. Normally wouldn&#39;t say anything, but it was touching the chicken and dipped in the sauce. We know this is no fault of our server. A manager comes over and apologizes and explains to us that he thinks it was a single corn silk. I am all about benefit of the doubt, but why would we have a single 1 in. cornsilk on our dish of lettuce wraps that does not involve corn? <br><br>My friend orders the pork chop and subs the mashed potatoes for roasted broccoli. I ordered the carbonara pasta with red pepper flakes. Food comes out and my friend receives mashed potatoes. We kindly told the food runner that she had broccoli. He returns with steamed broccoli. Again, normally wouldn&#39;t care, but our server had specifically asked if she wanted roasted or steamed. If you&#39;re not going to get it right, don&#39;t bother asking. Her pork chop was not served with a steak knife and I was left with a disappointingly bland pasta because I wasn&#39;t given the red pepper flakes either. My friend was attempting to cut her meat with a butter knife while I was tossing my pasta. The server has yet to check on us or our food. People who we should not have had to disturb: the food runner for our broccoli, the hostess for pepper flakes/ steak knife (who asked another server for assistance), another server passing by for the correct broccoli, and another server for the missing sauce cups. That&#39;s FIVE people we had to ask because of the absence of our server. <br><br>The second round of lettuce wraps is out--this time with no sauce. I found this ironic because when our first round of lettuce wraps with a single one inch corn silk came out, our server scoffed at it and noted that the plating was wrong. How can you notice that, but not notice that our second round had zero out of three sauces on it? Overall we had poor service. We are usually both understanding as we both work in high volume bars as well. We were disappointed in the poor service, the excuses, and were overall surprised that we had to pay for the lettuce wraps (missing all the sauces) that didn&#39;t come out until after our meal. I hate resorting to asking other servers to get things for us because we were not their table, but our server was inattentive and made the overall experience dreadful. I&#39;m disappointed that I paid money to once again have a terrible Cheesecake Factory experience.

This experience was a roller coaster experience for us. It started with an extensively long wait (like 25 minutes longer than we were quoted), and while I know some things are beyond their control, they needed to consider a plan B when the large party tables were full and the people at them were not leaving as quickly as they anticipated. We were a group of six, they could have put two of the little tables together. And while I appreciate all the options, the menu is way too long, and it is too difficult to choose... But I guess when you go to the Cheesecake Factory you aren&#39;t really going for the food anyway. By the time the dessert showed up, we were happy, but it took a long time to get there.

I have actually never been to Cheesecake Factory in all of my 27 years. We got a gift card from coworkers for our recent marriage &amp; decided to use it for date night. We were sat right away. Holy moly was it cold in there! Our waiter, Jeremy C, was great the entire time. No complaints there. We had two drinks &amp; an appetizer right away. Unfortunately the alcoholic beverages don&#39;t have a price beside them, so we were ordering blind. When we got our check, they were $12 a piece for a mixed drink! They were good, but not $12 good. So we had two drinks, one appetizer, two entrees, and 2 pieces of cheesecake for the road. After tax and tip, we spent $120 for the two of us. The food was EXTREMELY bland, nothing special that&#39;s for sure. All in all, not worth a $120 meal, definitely overpriced and under spiced. Glad we had a gift card, won&#39;t be returning.

Everything here was great except for our initial encounter, which is why I can&#39;t give it more than three stars. The good - Our waitress was good. She was efficient. It was late and my kids were hungry. She could tell and got everything out ASAP. The food was good.  Cheesecake was obviously good. <br><br>The bad - As much as we liked our waitress, she couldn&#39;t get our wine bottle open. No big deal. My husband handled it, but then she just left the bottle on the table and didn&#39;t pour it. Again, no big deal, but not what you are really expecting. My son has a shellfish allergy. I asked right off what our options were. Waitress informed us that everything is made to order and his meal would be made on a separate grill, cooks would switch gloves and to order whatever we would like. Awesome! That was great. But, I have a sneaking suspicion that didn&#39;t actually happen. I&#39;m not sure, but I just didn&#39;t get that feeling. Regardless, his meal was great so I can&#39;t comment more on that. <br><br>The worst part though was the banter between the hostesses. We had about a 20 minute wait to be seated. Now I get that this is in Ohio and they may not be used to the southern accent. But as we stood next to the hostess station and waited, a woman with a very southern accent came up and spoke to the hostess. The hostess immediately turned around and made fun of that woman with the other hostess. Very unprofessional. That really shouldn&#39;t happen. This lady wasn&#39;t rude or demanding. And she got made fun of right off the bat. And loud enough that I could hear it. Would it make me never go here again? No. But, it just didn&#39;t sit well. The staff should be better trained.

Ugh.  I stopped reading the menu on page 10.  The good news, our waiter was well trained and he knew the pages cold.  Really do you need such a huge menu.  Ugh.<br><br>It was a Saturday lunch and the wait approached an hour.  Where do they come from.<br><br>I opted for a garden salad.  It was huge and delicious.  Good choice.<br><br>Of course cheesecake, regular NY style.  Delicious.<br><br>I&#39;m not sure what i think of CF.  What I had was 4*.  Cheesecake 4*.  Menu 1*.  My server 4*.

Terrible service. I got the fish tacos. Definite thumbs down. VERY skimpy with the toppings. Definitely nothing like the description in the menu. And the ranch dressing on the salsas had a weird taste. The cheesecake however is yummy!!

Meh. Wasn&#39;t impressed. Service was great. The food was so-so. The salad was overdressed, absolutely drenched. Fries were cold. I dont think we will be back unless it&#39;s just for coffee and cheesecake...

This is not the best Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve visited. Every time I go, they seem to be out of something. This time they were out of the brown bread and ice cream. On top of that the women&#39;s restroom was disgusting...and out of toilet paper.<br><br>Do not recommend this location at all.

We had a bad experience here. It took forever to get our food. One meal was brought out first and it just sat there while we waited for the other five. Two were completely mixed up. With so many other options available and the possibility of a bad review like this one, why would you half ass your service?  We won&#39;t be back.
Absolutely love the Cheesecake Factory. Wonderful service, wonderful food. I will always recommend this place. Always spotless, kid friendly, and the workers are always phenomenal.

A very nice restaurant uniforms are nice u come down a long hallway leading to the hostess stand if the line is back at the front door it&#39;s busy. Walking down the long hallway is nice stone is all around u. Marble or granite  or looks like it.on ur right the slices of heaven. In front of u the dining room low lighting is good they have it.  They have nine types of cheese cake maybe more drinks are good food is a lot your going to take some home. I know they aren&#39;t the healthiest of places to eat some times u might over indulge&#34; eat this not that&#34; the books don&#39;t like them at all so maybe read some of he menu before<br>Going out but other then that a great place to eat and sample some slices of heaven!

I had a great dinner with my friends! Went in around 5:00pm and didn&#39;t have to wait. Service wasn&#39;t the fastest but our waiter was very sweet and made sure we had bread and drinks refilled. The dinners and desserts were delicious but a little over priced as expected, but everything was pretty good and I can&#39;t complain! Always worth the drive from Toledo.

Usually I love this place but I just spent 30 dollars on a steak that had to be sent back 3 times. Can&#39;t believe I didn&#39;t get my meal for free. Not to happy. <br>P.s. I&#39;m usually not one to complain

I honestly haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake Factory for over 5 years. If you&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory, then you&#39;ve been to them all. The ambience is same everywhere. It&#39;s nice and casual with food for everyone. It&#39;s a great place to sit down with your friends to eat after shopping. That&#39;s probably why every Cheesecake Factory is always packed with long lines, so always prepare to wait! I think they&#39;ve expanded their menu since 5 years ago. It&#39;s now 20 pages long with more choices!
We come here monthly. By far the best nachos in Columbus. When you order a burger medium rare, that&#39;s how it comes. Love this place!!

This was my very first time eating at Cheesecake Factory after it being on my bucket list for years! I&#39;m disappointed to say that it wasn&#39;t all that great. My main meal (Shrimp Angel Pasta with Tomato and Basil Sauce) was so bland that I could hardly taste it. I had to put a lot of salt and pepper on it and even ask the waiter to bring more sauce. The Greek salad was also bland tasting, like hardly any dressing was used. The best part was the Chocolate Mousse cheesecake! It was delicious! The service was alright. Contemplating whether to make a trip out here again.

This place is WAY overrated. I was hardly impressed. They should call this place The Sugar Factory<br><br>I had dinner at a Japanese restaurant in the Polaris mall food court where I got a huge portion of food at a great price, I decided to come here for dessert. All I could taste in the two different cheesecakes I ordered were just huge amounts of sugar. The pieces of cheesecake I ordered were caramel pecan and some kind of truffle, they&#39;re supposed to be different from each other but tasted nearly exactly the same and each layer I bit into had hardly any difference in taste besides just tasting like different textures of sugar. I could hear my kidneys and liver shrieking in pain because of the sugar overload from each bite.<br><br>This stuff is EXPENSIVE too! Totally not worth the money. they charge a fortune for just one piece of cheesecake, if it tasted amazing I wouldn&#39;t mind that, when I go to a grocery store though and buy a mass-produced piece of cheesecake for 1/5 of the cost it should NOT taste better than the one that costs a fortune that i ordered from this restaurant. One of the bakery staff had an attitude with me when I tried ordering too. I was standing in front of the bakery where there were two or three people working on the other side and I waited for someone to ask me if I needed help, I wasn&#39;t sure if this where I was supposed to order. No one asks me if I need anything after standing for a good moment. It seems like they assume people go out of their way to stare and admire their cheesecake in the bakery display like it&#39;s the Mona Lisa or something. I ask one of the women behind the counter if I can order cheesecake to go from the bakery counter and with an attitude she says &#34;she needs to help you&#34;. <br><br>If you want a nice sit-down restaurant experience there are TONS of other options near by and if you want a great value for your money the food court in the mall has good options too.

Our first trip tonight, we&#39;re excited to try it..  Will be our last.  Start out with being told a 40min to 1 hr wait.  That alone isn&#39;t to bad, but they have little room to stand and wait, so we head over to Barnes and noble to kill some time.  20 min later, we are back, standing in the long hallway waiting for our buzzer.  40 minutes of that sardine can joy, an hour since we checked in originally, I check in again.  Lady at the front counter had attitude, said we must have been paged while out of the building.  We took our reprimanding, decided to wait for that next available table.  30 more minutes, this time standing right by the counter, the attitude lady realizes we had been paged again, but it never went off.  This is where it went south.  Only a lip service apology, and we still had to wait, because others who had a similar issue were all trying to get seated at the same time.  <br><br>Finally get a table, the booth for two is cramped.  Waitress asks how things are going, but shrugs off our complaint.  Decided to avoid us since we were grumpy, our service was subpar, even though we cheered ourselves up and became pleasant to be around.<br><br>Then the food came out, and it was very average at best.  The crusted parmesan chicken was way to salty, the egg roll appetizer was pretty good, the eggplant Parmesan was very plain and average.  Took nearly 45 minutes to get dinner, and with the slow service we skipped desert .  After all, just going out to dinner on date night took up almost 4 hours.  But at least we had those 20 minutes at Barnes and noble.

Okay, you know what you&#39;re getting at Cheesecake Factory, right?  It&#39;s a chain.  I have no problem with mistakes in business - we all have &#39;em and the measure of our character is how we respond to them.  <br><br>So I ordered the Buffalo Burger on Oct 5th for a late lunch while my wife ordered a pizza and salad combo.  The buffalo burger has onion rings on it.  The food was delivered, I took my first bite and couldn&#39;t sink my teeth in - something hard was blocking it.  So I pulled out a long strip of hardened onion skin from one of the rings and set that aside.  Things happen I thought - it&#39;s just an onion.  Then again and again as each of the four onion rings had a strip of impenetrable onion skin that hadn&#39;t been peeled off until I had a small pile of them (see picture).<br><br>The waiter failed to return to check on me until I was three-fourths done with the burger.  At which time I *finally* got to ask for the ketchup for the fries and pointed out there was a problem with the food.  I said I didn&#39;t want to send it back (it was far too late and the rest was okay), but that he really should alert the kitchen that they&#39;d made a mistake.  I even picked up an onion skin strip and demonstrated that you could try to pull it apart but it was very strong and unchewable. <br><br>This should have set off alarm bells, but he said something like, &#34;oh, okay&#34; and left.  I would&#39;ve expected a manager to drop by within minutes but that didn&#39;t happen, meaning he didn&#39;t tell anyone.  Which means that serving bad food wasn&#39;t taken seriously.  To be clear, I did not want any sort of comp - no free food or desserts.  I only wanted the business to know about the mistake, take quality seriously and take steps to correct it.  But that did not happen, so we&#39;re done with Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;m going to upload a pic - I think Yelp hooks that to my review.

This location has its cons and pros. <br><br>On the bright side their bread is amazing, there are also couple good things on the menu. Avocado toast is my fav for now.<br>Service is also pretty good<br><br>For some reason in summer it is ABSOLUTELY FREEZING inside, when it&#39;s hot and you wear tshirt and shorts you will most likely freeze in the first 10 minutes there. <br>In winter it is super cold, especially the waiting area. I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s just the building designed that way or they are trying to make customers feel uncomfortable so they can leave sooner and there would be more rotation. <br>I don&#39;t like being cold or waiting over an hour for a table and than another 40 minutes for my food to come out.<br><br>Most possibly be back as the food is decent and desserts are good but it&#39;s not my favorite spot

Seeing as though Cheesecake Factory is historically like a fine tuned machine, this was not the case AT ALL for this location. Our party arrived at 5pm on Christmas Eve to many empty tables yet we were not seated until 5:50. After waiting with three children, we were finally seated. Drink orders were placed and did not arrive for 15 minutes. In between drinks being ordered and arriving we ordered dinner. We would like to believe that one of the reasons for the slowdown that was about to occur was due to our party of 12 + 3 kids being seated in the bar area (again, on Christmas Eve after waiting 55 mins). But alas, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory so we had faith. This faith quickly diminished as we waited over 50 minutes for food that arrived cold, missing ingredients (my lemon garlic shrimp had no sauce and the noodles were hard and lukewarm) and all at different times. The kids who ordered butter noodles had their meals arrive 35 minutes prior to the adult meals. They were finished and started squirming while the rest of us waited much longer. Even after the first round of meals were delivered and eaten (with mine being sent back) three others still had not gotten their food. Once those meals arrived, they were cold. By that time, half of our party had to get up and leave. We had been there an hour and a half and nothing was going right. We still wait another 20 minutes for our check in to settle up. The restaurant had given us a discount, but only for the food that come out cold or that nobody had eaten due to having to leave. We wound up on Christmas Eve with three other in our party never have eaten dinner. Frustrating to say the least. We won&#39;t be going back. It&#39;s one night later and we are across the street at Benihana. They told us that our reservation would not be seated for 45 minutes. We&#39;re still waiting for food 1.5 hours later

The bartender was really nice even while swamped with orders. If you like fruity drinks then I suggest the passion fruit mojito and typhoon punch. As for cheesecake the smores was great. My husband and I had a great time for our one year anniversary date. The place was beautiful, the atmosphere had a great vibe and I would definitely recommend to eat here.
Met friends here for lunch. Had great service and the Chicken Parm sandwich was wonderful! Also had Chris&#39;s Outragous Cheesecake! Superb!<br>Great experience.

I&#39;ve been here quite a few times even when it was extremely busy but today I was very disappointed today. I went in with my parents around 4 pm an it wasn&#39;t even crowded. The hostess asked how many and my mom said three and she said it would be a few minutes. I was extremely pissed off when there were other people that got seated and even a party of nine that just walked in got seated before us. The restaurant wasn&#39;t full at all. I asked to be seated and I was told that it would be another few minutes. Those extra few minutes turned out to be a full wasted 15 minutes. I hope that the manager reads this because I was highly displeased. I won&#39;t be coming back to this location because of this experience

My girlfriend and I stopped here for a late-night snack and dessert.  We ordered a chicken quesadilla, two pops and a slice of cheesecake.  It was $30+ for the stop.<br><br>The service was GREAT.  We loved our server.  She was fun, energetic, helpful, and all of the other words that go with a great server.  She even pointed out that she was a SERVER, NOT a waitress.  She served people.  Fantastic.<br><br>The patio was also a nice atmosphere for our late night visit.<br><br>When the check came though, we remembered why we only go to Cheesecake Factory occasionally.  Wow is it overpriced.
The wait time was 1 1/2 hours. After that another hour to get your food. Drinks didn&#39;t come out together. Oh yea, ended up throwing up half the night after eating here. Pick another spot.

Went to the Polaris location for my daughters birthday dinner. Disappointing to say the least. Service was marginal. Silverware was dirty. Left a spoon and knife on tables edge for replacement. Server never looked at it. Finally, pointed it out and he did not replace.  Food was OK. Burger was overcooked. Chicken in salad was horrible. Fried shrimp was very good. Worst of all was the dessert. Found a long piece of paper in the cheesecake. Server saw it left on plate and said &#34;was that in the cheesecake?&#34; When we answered yes, he said nothing further, shook his head and left. Will not be returning...

The Cheesecake Factory outdoes themselves every time and this time is no exception. We Doordashed them while hanging out at Level One at Crosswoods. It arrived much sooner than expected, the warm food was still warm. If you are an avocado-file like me, you MUST try the Avocado Spring Rolls!! I don&#39;t know what the sauce is that comes with them, but it&#39;s REALLY good!!  The BaconBacon Burger was thoroughly enjoyed and of course the Oreo Cheesecake was the bomb. Thanks Cheesecake Factory! Unfortunately, I was so ravenous that I forgot to take photos of our beautiful food, but I&#39;ll catch them next time.

Very disappointing. Ordered the $20 Fettuccini Alfredo with blackened chicken.  First of all, the chicken was not blackened, but the worst part was the sauce. It had no flavor and was water thin. I expressed my disappointment to the waitress, and after seeing that I barely ate any, I thought she&#39;d take it off my bill, but she charged me full price. I will never go back to the Cheesecake Factory. Never.
The cheesecake is good, don&#39;t get me wrong, but nothing special above store bought.  It&#39;s always too busy to just come in and sit down-always a wait.
Bang for your buck: 3/10<br>Quality: 5.5/10<br>Service: 8/10<br>Ambiance/Location: 7/10<br>Overall: 6/10

Very disappointing, wont return. Prices were too high for the quality of the food. The cheesecake was the highlight though. <br>The server was nice but food...no Bueno!<br>Menu is too big to execute at high quality..160+items. I ordered a pasta dish that was priced at $17.95. The shrimp in the pasta were &#34;bay&#34; shrimp...very small that are usually used for shrimp salad, some were over cooked. Sent dish back and got meatloaf...tasted ok, not great, but portion size was huge...id rather a smaller portion for less money. Husband ordered a French dip sandwich...usually on a baguette of sorts but came out on a sesame seed bun, like a burger bun, which the menu did not state, and my husband cant eat seeds. Our bill was over $100 and when we left we were very disappointed. Next time we want a nice dinner we&#39;ll stick to Bravo and Hyde Park.

I come here becuase I always look &#34;the big bang theory&#34; on italian tv. So I really MUST come. <br>The restaurant is a bit big for my standard. Seems a big chain rest.  But waiters was really nice and professional. Food was really good. <br><br>One thing. One night my choice was finished. A teryaky steak or something like that. They refuse to serve me this with a different cut but same treatmen because they wasn&#39;t sure that can be good as the standard. <br><br>I never eat it so they can serve me anything (remember I&#39;m italian and we don&#39;t have cheescake factory). But they prefer keep they standard at high level. <br><br>And this for me is very professional.

We waited over an hour to be seated and our server was a little slow! But the food was so so so so good. I ordered the macaroni and cheese burger and it was absolutely amazing! The burger was juicy and flavorful and the macaroni and cheese on it was an amazing touch. I loved the ambiance.

Do NOT recommend take-out from here! This use to be my absolute favorite place. I have come here for my birthday every year for the past 7 years. Each year the quality has progressively gotten worse. From finding hair&#39;s in my food, the tiny portions, and getting the cold &amp; sloppy take-out it makes coming here WAY less enjoyable. <br>The inconsistency in the staff is mentionable as well. Sometimes you get a waiter/waitress that follows the rules and makes for a memorable experience. Other times NOT so much; sometimes you get waiter/waitress willing to cut corners not, giving you the full experience. It&#39;d be nice to know that (on average) every time you go in you&#39;re getting someone who pleasant and willing to do job. Genuinely sad that my business will be spent elsewhere because this was my go-to choice for the longest time. Step it up, Cheesecake.
It shocks me that The Cheesecake Factory does not filter their water!? Columbus water is not healthy and tastes horrible! It&#39;s just tacky to offer gross city water!? Get it together people!

First everything  was dirty from the forks to the plates.Then after we got new everything we ordered it took way to long and then the cheese stuffed burger when i took a bite the little bit of cheese that was in it fell onto the plate. It was just bad all around.

We have been to Cheesecake Factory a bunch of times. The last few times we have visited the experience has gone downhill a little each time. This time tonite was the worst. Being a Tuesday we thought it would be in and out. We sat down in a timely manner but everything else was super super slow. We waited about 10 minutes before our waiter came over. When he finally came we ordered our drinks and our food. The people next to us got their food right after we ordered. They ate, paid and left. Still no food for us. The waiter said it&#39;s coming about 3 times. Then the manager came and apologized and said it&#39;s coming. Then another couple sat down next to us. We finally got our food, about 50 minutes later. Meanwhile the couple next to us ate, paid and left before we got our check paid so we could leave. We assumed that after all that we would have some kind of comp on our bill. We did not. Then, to make things worse, I left my (very sentimental) birthday card on the booth seat when we got up. I realized when we were pulling out of the parking lot. I called to have them grab it and the hostess said no one has seen it. I spoke to a manager and she finally admitted that the buser saw it, said there was nothing in it so he threw it away. Super disappointed. The food was okay.

I&#39;m noticing a theme here with the online menus not posting prices. This makes it very frustrating when deciding on trying new things at new places. *Edit* Since customer service responded within 24 hours of this review and showed me where I was wrong initially the rating goes from one star to 5 stars. Kudos Cheesecake Factory great customer service goes a long way! :-)

Ok food.  Exceedingly slow service and very little follow-up attention from our waitress.  It took almost 40 minutes for our food to arrive.  My wife and I were about to leave when the food arrived.  Not what one would expect from this chain.

Had dinner there today.  Awful awful AWFUL food!!<br><br>My son&#39;s chicken tenders were over-fried and there was more crispy batter than chicken in the tenders.<br><br>I had the large chicken burrito.  BIG mistake!  It was full of plain white rice which was so undercooked that it was crunchy in my mouth! 75% of the burrito was filled with the hard white rice and it had no seasoning!  I think there were 2 tiny pieces of chicken in the entire large burrito!  <br><br>I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in almost a decade and I definitely won&#39;t be back!

Love the location of this place right next to the mall! All he cheesecakes are amazing and they have so many options! Prices for everything can be pretty expensive here though. Probably around $30+ after taxes and tips just for an entree and cheesecake. It gets really busy and crowded sometimes and it&#39;s hard to hear with all the TVs playing at once and servers bustling around

***3.5 stars***<br><br>It&#39;s not local... I know I shouldn&#39;t be here... I&#39;m full of shame... BLAH BLAH BLAH. <br><br>I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in at least 6 years. It&#39;s not that I hate it; it&#39;s just not really my thing. Big portions, big chain, big prices, etc. <br><br>Well tonight I was at Polaris mall getting a massage at Comfort Zone (trust me--don&#39;t judge), and the Mister and I needed dinner. He wanted pasta, and since I have this wheat thing, he rarely gets it. <br><br>It dawned on me that CF probably had a gluten-free menu, so I gave them a quick call--and they did! I placed our order, and then they told me I could PARK OUTSIDE AND THEY WOULD BRING MY FOOD. <br><br>What?!<br><br>Maybe I&#39;m just easily amused, but the Cheesecake Factory impressed me tonight with their GF menu and the way they let me be lazy. <br><br>As for the food, it&#39;s your typical CF fare. Everything was good. Not amazing, but still tasty. I definitely don&#39;t think I&#39;ll wait another 6 years before heading back!

My drink was really good and the lights are really low and the place has this cool vibe, but my food was cold and when i had it sent back they just microwaved it for a minute.  I know because the shrimp was too chewy to eat.  Our waitress was really nice about it, but for the price i feel like the food should be better quality than what was brought to me.  Never even got to speak to a manager about it

Let&#39;s get straight to the point...the Cheesecake is the best part about this place. <br><br>Don&#39;t be fooled by the ambiance, the decor, or the biblical sized menu,<br>-- side note: I&#39;ve never understood restaurants with 15 page menus. How can you boast having good food when you have to be able to cook that many items. I&#39;d rather sacrifice quantity for a little quality. --<br>because all that really matters is the cheesecake. <br><br>My recommendation: order the cheesecake first and your entrée second. You don&#39;t want to fill up on bread and food and then miss the best part. <br><br>Personal favorite, the raspberry and lemon cheesecake. Light, tangy, fruity, and smooth.

My sister and I frequent the Cheesecake Factory as a tradition to celebrate our birthdays.  We were seated at 12:20pm in a section that was full of 2-top and 4-top tables. There was no indication, to us, that the entire left side of this section was all one group. <br><br>The waitress took our order in a timely manner, but after about 20 minutes, the wrong appetizer was delivered to our table. The correct appetizer didn&#39;t arrive until 1:15 - just 2-3 minutes before our main entrees were served.  <br><br>We noticed that around 12:45, the waiters were yelling, &#34;Who had the....&#34; to the group of small tables, as they served their meals and realized the section was filled with a business group. <br> <br>Once the group finished eating (at about the time we were being served), an awards meeting began.  The leader was standing right by my seat, (with her &#34;behind&#34; in my face) calling people up for awards, hugs, and photos.  This STOPPED the wait staff from checking on our table, and stopped our ability to hold a conversation. <br><br>The manager who said that she had already dealt with a previous problem regarding that group offered us a weak apology and a slice of cheesecake. Pathetic. <br><br>It looks like we&#39;ll find a new venue for our traditional birthday lunch.

I order from the skinny menu and my boyfriend gets the honey chicken or something from the pasta. I enjoy that the calories are printed in the menu so you know how many are in each product. The menu selection is plentiful and the service is okay. I tried the cheesecake once and it was very sweet so I made two desserts out of it. The wait is very long most of the times went (granted we eat during normal dinner hours so we expect it). The portion sizes are large so there are always leftovers.

Since I don&#39;t believe in providing a 1- or 5-star review upon one visit to a restaurant, I&#39;ll refrain from doing so this time. However, if I were to do that, I&#39;d grade my latest experience 1-star. <br><br>As far as the pros go, the menu is filled with so many options, no matter how picky one might be, he/she is bound to find something to their liking. The server was also quite friendly.<br><br>In saying all of that, however, as I was in the mood for something &#34;Cajun&#34; and I stumbled upon a speciality dish called &#34;Cajun Chicken Littles,&#34; I ordered that and came away extremely disappointed. The dish is described on the menu as: &#34;Boneless Breast of Chicken Pieces, Spiced, Breaded and Fried Crisp...&#34; When I took my first bite, I could tell there was absolutely nothing &#34;Cajun&#34; about it and nothing &#34;little&#34; about it either. When the waitress returned, I asked for some Cajun seasoning, since it had appeared I was served two orders of regular chicken tenders with barbecue sauce on the side. When she returned, she said, &#34;I&#39;m sorry, but this order isn&#39;t Cajun and isn&#39;t little. Here&#39;s some blackened seasoning. Hopefully that helps.&#34; Really? A dish is called &#34;Cajun Chicken Littles&#34; and 2/3 of the title is inaccurate? If I had known the &#34;Cajun Chicken&#34; wasn&#39;t Cajun, I would have ordered something else. Not only that, but while I quickly lost my appetite and didn&#39;t eat much of the disappointing meal, I wasn&#39;t offered a discount for the slip-up. Hopefully my dog likes the leftovers...

A quick note here: Eat at the Easton location if you can. Polaris has the worst layout ever. I won&#39;t go back again if I can help it.<br><br>I&#39;ve always enjoyed this restaurant. This time around was no different. The server was a super friendly &amp; attentive Eastern European woman - best server I&#39;ve had in a while!<br><br>I love the bread, but it wasn&#39;t as hot &amp; fresh as it should be (on every refill). My dish was very good (spicy cashew chicken). It was well cooked &amp; presented. Could be spicy for your average joe, but I&#39;m a spice freak, so I would&#39;ve preferred more. My Sam Adams seasonal beer was very crisp &amp; refreshing. For dessert, I got the strawberry cheesecake. It was absolutely to die for. Thick, rich body, fresh strawberries in a sauce, thick &amp; generous whipped cream, &amp; a tasty crust.<br><br>Overall a good experience. Another note: they don&#39;t take reservations on the weekend.

Decided to skip the crowd &amp; do carryout for Valentine&#39;s Day dinner.  Called &amp; ordering was fast &amp; easy.  Pulled up to the to-go parking and called to let them know I was waiting.  About 10 minutes later a girl came out with the food &amp; took another 5 minutes to run my credit card.  I got there right at the quoted time, but food didn&#39;t feel very warm.  Got home a few minutes later &amp; it was pretty cold &amp; mashed potatoes were super lumpy.  Portions seem much smaller than when you dine-in.  Also they should put sauces on the side so food doesn&#39;t get soggy.  Overall it was an ok experience, but definitely not worth $57.

Not one of my favorites anymore didn&#39;t know what to order so I asked about their new Korean  fried cauliflower that my daughters rave about and he was telling me that it wasn&#39;t good that he would never order it so I ordered the dynamite shrimp which is supposed to be crispy temper and there was nothing crispy about it at all it was a very lack luster appetizer my husband&#39;s hamburger was supposed to be meeting him and was more well done and his fries didn&#39;t come out until he was halfway done with that very  attentive waiter

Dear Cheesecake Factory,<br>I did contact you...you assured me that<br>You were very sorry for our experience,and sent us a whole $10 dollars as an &#34;apology&#34; Considering we spent $70 on dinner $10 is quite a slap in the face! A restaurant that can&#39;t refill drinks or bring hot food to the table,yet expect us to return because you sent $10 ?You should really be a comedy club.
The food is good, and the service is excellent. I prefer this location to the one near my home (Cincinnati).

Made the mistake of coming here the day of OSU graduation, so everyone and their mothers decided to eat here. The wait was over an hour. Four people at my table ended up getting sick. I have a fever and pretty bad muscle aches. Maybe in the mad rush to serve the crowd, no one followed food safety guidelines.

The Cheesecake Factory at Polaris hosted myself and the fetching Mrs. Rat on 5/14/16 for dinner. We arrived at 5:45pm to find the place overrun with Prom goers. While waiting to get to the reservation station, a group in front of us offered their buzzer as they were not going to wait the 90 minutes predicted by the hostess. We passed the buzzer to a party of four. After waiting 8 minutes we were escorted to our table. We ordered iced tea and pot-stickers. They arrived in a timely fashion and the pot-stickers were very good. Our waitress was superb and did not hover around, she gave us plenty of time to peruse the vast menu. The fetching Mrs. Rat ordered steak medallions with grilled spring vegetables. The presentation was pleasing to the eye and the food was tasty to the tongue. I had the steak Diane &amp; salmon combination with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The steak was grilled to perfection. The salmon was a bit more done for my taste.
